channel.title: Comments on: Beyond Berlin: Difference in the Wet Country
channel.description: See Berlin through a lens of migration and difference

item.title: By: Max S.
item.dc:creator: Max S.
item.description:
I think about this almost innate diversity that many parts of the US are endowed with (including the one i was raised in), more and more with more time away. i feel like it informs my sense of nationhood/nationality greater than most other aspects of my upbringing - which often leads to me being at odds with other (read: european) perspectives on nationality.
also, "Walmart’s to nowhere" - niiice.
item.content:encoded:
I think about this almost innate diversity that many parts of the US are endowed with (including the one i was raised in), more and more with more time away. i feel like it informs my sense of nationhood/nationality greater than most other aspects of my upbringing – which often leads to me being at odds with other (read: european) perspectives on nationality.

also, “Walmart’s to nowhere” – niiice.
